data.title: LCCC Commencement Ceremony Recognizes Graduates
data.text:
Schnecksville, Pa., June 27, 2023 – Lehigh Carbon Community College held its 56th annual Commencement ceremonies on Wednesday, May 17, at the PPL Center in downtown Allentown. Commencement recognized the nearly 950 students who have earned associate degrees, certificates or diplomas from December 2022, May 2023 and anticipated for August 2023.

LCCC president Dr. Ann D. Bieber presided over the ceremonies. Chair of the LCCC Board of Trustees David L. Krause offered the welcome.

Nathali Acevedo and Rolando Pineda were selected as this year’s student speakers. Acevedo, of Allentown, moved to the U.S. from the Dominican Republic eight years ago. She will earn her associate in arts degree in Communication as one of the August 2023 graduates. Pineda, of Allentown, earned his associate in applied science degree in Computer Specialist-Network Technology. He plans to continue his studies to earn his bachelor’s degree from Western Governor’s University.

The Students of the Year, selected annually by the LCCC Faculty Association, were announced during the ceremony. Emma Hope, of Tamaqua, graduated with an associate in science degree in psychology. She plans to transfer to Kutztown University to continue her education in psychology. The Early College Student of the Year is Selena Bauder, of Panther Valley, who is anticipated to graduate with her associate in arts degree in general studies. She plans to transfer to Penn State University in State College, where she will major in criminal psychology.

Dr. Melanie Turrano, professor of English and president of the LCCC Faculty Association, served as grand marshal for the ceremonies, assisted by faculty members Robert J. Oravitz, Richard Paterick, Jr., Tim Shoemaker, William B. Smith, Dr. Roxanne Wright Watson and Eric M. Werley.

Class of 2023 graduate Heidi Cannon, who received her associate in applied science degree in Early Childhood Education/Early Intervention, sang the national anthem and the LCCC alma mater.

Larissa Verta, vice president of academic services and student development, presented the candidates for graduation.

The following individuals received academic awards:

All-Pennsylvania Academic Team – Emma Hope and Evangelique Myers

Joanne Gerken Graduation Speaker Awards – Nathali Acevedo and Rolando Pineda

Commencement Soloist Award – Heidi Cannon

Climax Goulder Bealine Award – Zachary Reph

Outstanding Mathematics Student of the Year – Molly Smith

Lehigh County Chapter of American Association of Medical Assistants Award – Brianna McCutcheon –

Lehigh County Medical Society Award – Ashley Gearheart and Rileigh Hoffner

Associate Degree in Nursing, Faculty Recognition Award – Ina Dutt

Student Nurses Association of Pennsylvania (SNAP) – LCCC Chapter Service Award – Mikayla E. Shankweiler

Wayne E. Kirker (Physical Therapist Assistant) Award – Jill Milks

Professor William L.F. and Mrs. Mary Joan Schmehl Political Science Organization Alumni Award – Alexander M. Tarantino

Distinction in Psychology Award – Adrianna Ault

Distinction in Science Award – Cameron Smith

Professor Elizabeth (Bette) Hummer (Social Science) Memorial Award – Stephanie A. Helt

Teacher Education Student Association Scholarship Award – Heidi Cannon

Jennifer Smith Memorial Veterinary Technician Award – Kaitlyn Kistler

Wright Veterinary Medical Center Veterinary Technician Award – Jessica Detweiler and Alyssa M. Sanchez
